cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (120 km) NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast on Friday, cross the southern-central Florida Peninsula Saturday, then move into the western Atlantic and continue northeastward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west coast of the Florida Peninsula (near Naples/Ft. Myers area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County line (including Lake Okeechobee) and west coast south of Longboat Key, plus Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida Peninsula, including Palm Beach County and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (peak gusts 40-45 mph) Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation up to 1–2 ft possible but significant surge >3 ft not expected at Palm Beach
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches, locally up to 12 inches, with considerable flash and urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and hazardous marine/boating conditions in the Lake Worth Inlet and adjacent coastal waters
